about_the_game:
It is a mix of a classic RPG and CCG. In the game, instead of cards with different abilities, you define the actions of the characters by rolling dice. Each dice has various effects on its faces.

But you can still control the battlefield! You can manage the element of random by using various abilities and items that allow you to re-roll, change the order of actions, or modify the final effects.

Collectible Card Game


A collectible card game (CCG) but with dice instead of cards to bring more fun and randomness to the game. The random aspect can still be managed with the help of skills, items, and other mechanics.

RPG Elements


The tabletop role-playing game spirit, combat mechanics with dice, and RPG elements, such as dialogues, and non-combat encounters. All this is merged with the fun of CCG style.

The Best Combat Mechanics


● Plenty of heroes with their own abilities and characteristics, and you choose who will go on a dangerous mission.
● Collecting dice with various effects on their sides and abilities that affect during the turn.
● A turn-based duel in which your opponent's move depends on randomness, but randomness on your actions.
● Items that allow you to change the properties of dice right during the battle. Or sacrifice them (dice) for the sake of beneficial effects.
● Using the entourage to help the party. Dropping chandeliers on your opponents, activating traps, searching for secret paths, and even more.

Customizable Settings


The consistency and predictable randomness of Dicey Dungeons, but with a more mature setting and non-combat encounters.

Diversified Gameplay


The game cycle with drastically different gameplay.
Gather the party of heroes with different characteristics. Equip them and send on adventures. Roll dice to fight. Use abilities to change the result of the battle at will. Get a collection of dice, classes, and items and go further and further into more dangerous areas of this world every time.

Unique Story


A world where gods do exist. They are feared and revered, they are powerful like no other creature of this world. But, as it turned out, gods are mortal. Eventually, the Goddess of Fortune was killed by those who were deprived of luck. And chaos reigned in the world. Cataclysms, crop failures, monsters... failures for everyone.

In this difficult time, the Order of Fortune Handlers was born. Heroes who dedicated their lives to trying to curb chaos and take their luck into their own hands. They travel the world and take on a wide variety of tasks, helping with advice on the spot or with their blades.

Will the Order, mastering the art of the one who destroyed Luck, be able to restore order to the world? Or plunge it into even more chaos?
